contentList:
Anosmia -- Cold damage -- You lose your sense of smell and taste. You automatically fail any ability checks that involve your sense of smell or taste. The condition heals if you receive any magical healing. Anosmia is intended Cold damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Blindness -- Acid damage -- Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the blinded condition. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your sight. Blindness is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness.
Intended severity: High.
Your eyes are destroyed; you have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, the range of your attacks and spells are reduced to [1].
Attack Rolls against Blinded creatures have Advantage.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Your eyes are destroyed; you have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, the range of your attacks and spells are reduced to [1].
Attack Rolls against Blinded creatures have Advantage.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Blisters -- Acid damage -- You have severe blisters. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks. The blisters heal if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the blisters and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After seven successes, the blisters heal. Blindness is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Destroyed Foot -- Acid damage -- Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a crutch or cane to move. You fall prone after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Destroyed foot is intended for Acid, Cold and Lightning damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
Your Movement Speed is halved. If you use the Dash action you fall Prone at the end of your turn. You have Disadvantage on Acrobatics checks.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Your Movement Speed is halved. If you use the Dash action you fall Prone at the end of your turn. You have Disadvantage on Acrobatics checks.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Gangrene of the Foot -- Cold damage Explosive Grounding of the Foot -- Lightning damage Destroyed Hand -- Acid damage. -- You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost appendage. Destroyed Hand is intended for Acid, Cold, Lightning and Bludgeoning damage.
Intended severity: High.
You are Disarmed upon being injured. You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. You are Disarmed upon being injured. You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Gangrene of the Hand -- Cold damage Explosive Grounding of the Hand -- Lightning damage Broken Arm -- Bludgeoning Damage Frostbitten Foot -- Cold damage -- Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action. If you fail the save, you fall prone. Magical healing cures the frostbite. Alternatively, your foot can be treated with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, in which case it will heal naturally in 2 weeks. Frostbitten Foot is intended for Cold damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
Your Movement Speed is reduced by [1]. You must make a Dexterity Saving Throw after using the Dash action or fall Prone at the end of your turn.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Your Movement Speed is reduced by [1]. You must make a Dexterity Saving Throw after using the Dash action or fall Prone at the end of your turn.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Frostbitten Hand -- Cold damage Frostbitten Hand is intended for Cold damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save, you suffer from Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks if you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save you suffer from Disadvantage on Attack Rolls as well as Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks if you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Horrible Disfigurement -- Acid damage --You have acid burns to the extent that the scars can't be easily concealed. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Horrible Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Medium.
You have acid burns to the extent that the scars can't be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. You have acid burns to the extent that the scars can't be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Major Neuralgia -- Cold and Acid damage -- You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal and regenerate, cures the neuralgia, or if you spend twenty days doing nothing but resting it resolves on its own. Major Neuralgia is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury just with a higher DC saving throw.
Intended severity: High.
You are in constant pain from nerve damage. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, cures the neuralgia. You are in constant pain from nerve damage. At the beginning of your turn in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, cures the neuralgia. Minor Disfigurement -- Acid damage -- You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as heal or regenerate, remove the acid burn scars. Minor Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Minor Neuralgia -- Cold and Acid damage -- This has the same effect as Major Neuralgia above, except that the save DC is 10 and it only takes ten days to resolve on its own. Minor Neuralgia is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury with a higher DC saving throw.
Intended severity: Low.
You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, cures the neuralgia. Partial Blindness -- Acid damage -- Your eyes are damaged; you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can heal the damage to your eyes. If you have already suffered partial blindness, you're blinded. Partial Blindness is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness.
Intended severity: High.
Your eyes are damaged. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Partial Blindness and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Your eyes are damaged. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Partial Blindness and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Ocular Damage -- Cold damage -- One of your corneas is damaged from frostbite. You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged cornea. If you have no corneas that remain undamaged after sustaining this injury, you're blinded. One of your corneas is damaged from frostbite. You have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Ocular Damage and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore the damaged cornea. Systematic Damage -- Cold damage -- You have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability checks and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. Magic such as the regenerate spell cures this damage. Systematic Damage is intended for Cold damage.
Intended severity: High.
You have Disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Ability Checks and Saving Throws.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can cure the damage. You have Disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Ability Checks and Saving Throws.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can cure the damage.
